data.name: Ruby blocks handling
data.description:
Imagine, while learning Ruby you discovered its magic blocks and a lot of different awesome keywords. So, after reading docs you found there is different ways one could escape a running block and decided to write a simple class to test how blocks behave.

Task is simple: implement a class BlockTester. Its constructor should take a block and instance of the class should have a method 'test'. Of course BlockTester#test should carefully call a block with any provided parameters and return a detailed result.

For your convenience there is already provided class CallResult in a preloaded code:
```ruby
VALID_STATUSES = %i[ok error break return throw]

class CallResult
  attr_reader :status, :value, :tag, :error
  
  def initialize(status, value: nil, tag: nil, error: nil)
    # some obvious code
  end
  
  # some obvious code
end
```
Method BlockTester#test should return an instance of CallResult with an appropriate status and with other fields (where they make sense). Sample tests could explain how to use CallResult and what data is supposed to be returned in different cases.
